title: YouTube is cracking down on videos with medical misinformation
description: Let's hope this will help you avoid your aunt's "It works; I saw it on YouTube" remedy next Thanksgiving.

title: The best 43-inch TVs of 2023
description: You can stream your favorite shows and movies in cozier spots without sacrificing a great picture by choosing the best 43-inch TVs.

title: Google is beefing up AI-powered search to help you better understand the results
description: You can try out the three new features just added to Google's Search Generative Experience. Here's how.

title: You can build your own AI chatbot with this drag-and-drop tool
description: We try out Botpress, a tool that helps you create powerful AI-based chatbots.

title: How to create templates for Gmail (and why they can make your life easier)
description: Gmail makes it very simple to create and reuse templates to make it easier to send boilerplate communications, so you don't always have to type the same information over and over.

title: Amazon now using generative AI to summarize customer reviews
description: Available on a wide number of products for many US shoppers on mobile devices, the AI tech will condense all the customer reviews into one digestible paragraph.

title: World's first smart door is on sale at Home Depot today. You probably can't afford it
description: Masonite's M-PWR door comes with a built-in smart lock and video doorbell, but it doesn't come cheap

title: Apple to begin payments to iPhone users in $500 million throttling settlement
description: Batterygate​ payday is here at last. Here's what eligible customers can expect and when.

title: Hardware fails, but I've never lost data thanks to this backup plan
description: SanDisk Extreme SSDs aren't the only storage devices to fail. While data loss can be sudden and catastrophic, storage is cheap. Here's how I limit my risk exposure.

title: Mystery iPhone 15 USB-C chip sparks wild theories but here's what it's really for
description: An iPhone 15 component leak showing an unidentified '3LD3' chip leads to some outlandish speculations as to what Apple might be up to.

title: I've tested hundreds of phone cases. Here's why the Everyday Case is my favorite
description: Peak Design's unique SlimLink system makes the Everyday Case the perfect protection for your mobile device. Add one accessory -- or 10 -- and optimize your smartphone experience.

title: Netflix lets the games begin for some TV, computer users
description: Offering two games to start, the limited beta test is aimed at select Netflix subscribers.

title: Comcast introduces 'Storm-Ready WiFi' to help you stay online during power outages
description: It's hurricane season again in the US. Is your tech ready?

title: 67% of IT leaders say AI can increase employee efficiency
description: AMD's new survey of 2,500 global IT leaders reveals most regard AI tools positively, even though over half haven't personally used them yet.

title: Buy 10TB of lifetime cloud backup for $100 right now
description: Enjoy high-speed transfers from a database that offers more storage space than Dropbox, OneDrive, and Google Drive combined.

title: Window Maker Live is a throwback to the exciting days of early Linux
description: This Linux distribution isn't for the average user. But for those who've been around the block a few times, Window Maker Live is a wonderful homage to what Linux was like back in the day.

title: Instagram adds a musical twist to photo sharing, as well as other new features
description: Want to make your Instagram photos more fun or expressive? Well, now you can add music.
